intro: Tarenna axillaris, commonly known as the mountain tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
